organisation.name: Greenwood College
organisation.about: Greenwood College is committed to delivering high-quality further education that supports learners in achieving their academic and vocational goals. We are seeking an enthusiastic and knowledgeable College Lecturer to deliver engaging lessons, support student progression, and contribute to the wider college community.
organisation.safeguardingCommitment: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all learners and expect all staff to share this commitment.

title: Lecturer in construction
skillsAndExperience: Ideal candidates should have strong subject knowledge and experience teaching or training within a further education or post-16 setting. Excellent communication skills, the ability to deliver engaging and well-structured lessons, and a commitment to supporting diverse learners are essential. Experience in curriculum planning, assessment, and supporting student progression is highly desirable.
whatSchoolOffers:
- A supportive and collaborative college environment
- Opportunities for professional development and teaching qualifications
- The chance to make a meaningful impact on learners' academic and vocational pathways.
safeguardingCommitment: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all learners, and expect all staff to share this commitment.
furtherDetailsAboutTheRole: Applicants should hold a relevant degree or industry qualification and, ideally, a recognised teaching qualification or willingness to work towards one. A DBS check is required.

organisation.name: Greenwood College
organisation.about: Greenwood College is committed to delivering high-quality further education that supports learners in achieving their academic and vocational goals. We are seeking a dedicated Student Support Officer to help learners overcome barriers to learning and succeed in their studies.
organisation.safeguardingCommitment: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all learners and expect all staff to share this commitment.

title: Student Support Officer
skillsAndExperience: Ideal candidates will have experience supporting students in an education or training environment. Strong communication skills, empathy, and the ability to work collaboratively with teaching staff are essential.
whatSchoolOffers:
- A supportive and inclusive college environment
- Opportunities for professional development
- The chance to make a meaningful difference to learners’ educational journeys.
safeguardingCommitment: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all learners, and expect all staff to share this commitment.
furtherDetailsAboutTheRole: Applicants should have relevant experience working with young people or adults in an educational setting. A DBS check is required.

organisation.name: Riverside Technical College
organisation.about: Riverside Technical College provides vocational and technical education to learners across the region, working closely with local employers to develop practical skills for employment. We are seeking a committed Learner Progress Coach to support students in achieving positive outcomes and progressing to their next steps.
organisation.safeguardingCommitment: Riverside Technical College is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults.

title: Learner Progress Coach
skillsAndExperience: The successful candidate will have experience working with learners in an education, training, or youth support setting. You will be confident providing one-to-one guidance, monitoring progress, and working with teaching teams to identify and address barriers to learning.
whatSchoolOffers:
- A learner-focused and inclusive college culture
- Flexible working arrangements
- Ongoing training and development opportunities
- The opportunity to support learners into education, employment or training.
safeguardingCommitment: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all learners and expect all staff to share this commitment.
furtherDetailsAboutTheRole: Applicants should have relevant experience in learner support or pastoral roles. A willingness to work flexibly across departments is essential. An enhanced DBS check will be required.
